item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, September 14, 2024 at 2:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Meet.hn – Meet the Hacker News community in your city (117 points | 46 comments)
2. The Department of Everything – Dispatches from the telephone reference desk (17 points | 8 comments)
3. They don't make readers like they used to (22 points | 13 comments)
4. My 71 TiB ZFS NAS After 10 Years and Zero Drive Failures (337 points | 241 comments)
5. The data on extreme human ageing is rotten from the inside out (65 points | 23 comments)
6. Lisp implemented in Rust macros (246 points | 59 comments)
7. Why use metaphors in conflicts? Because understanding is remembering in disguise (2009) (36 points | 22 comments)
8. Techniques I use to create a great user experience for shell scripts (328 points | 161 comments)
9. Icon (real creators, AI ads) is hiring founding engineers (NYC) ( | hide)
10. Porting SBCL to the Nintendo Switch (358 points | 63 comments)
11. The Legend of Holy Sword: An Immersive Experience for Concentration Enhancement (112 points | 53 comments)
12. Void captures over a million Android TV boxes (112 points | 64 comments)
13. Billiards is a good game (1975) (50 points | 24 comments)
14. Defend against vampires with 10 gbps network encryption (220 points | 66 comments)
15. CrowdStrike ex-employees: 'Quality control was not part of our process' (463 points | 224 comments)

20. Grounding AI in reality with a little help from Data Commons (78 points | 11 comments)

22. The Cellular Secret to Resisting the Pressure of the Deep Sea (66 points | 10 comments)
23. Zero-Click Calendar invite vulnerability chain in macOS (414 points | 149 comments)
24. Coupled Oscillators for Computing (30 points | 8 comments)
25. Ambient Meaning and the Algorithms of Culture (22 points | 6 comments)
26. Valkey achieved one million RPS 6 months after forking from Redis (80 points | 17 comments)
27. Intel Solidifies $3.5B Deal to Make Chips for Military (163 points | 117 comments)
28. Gottfried Mind, the Raphael of Cats (31 points | discuss)
29. Janet Jackson had the power to crash laptop computers (2022) (177 points | 56 comments)
30. Martin Luther King Jr. In Berlin (83 points | 19 comments)
